rules: Rule1: Provided that a Team observes a Cell, then the Project is successful.
Rule2: A Team either observes a Cell or records a Video.
Rule3: If a Team discovers a Protein, then the Team does not contaminate a Sample.
Rule4: Under the condition that a Team isolates a Gene, the Team does not contaminate a Sample.
Rule5: If a Team sequences DNA, then the Team discovers a Protein.
Rule6: Under the condition that a Team maps a Genome, the Team isolates a Gene.
Rule7: A Team either patents a Method or publishes Findings.
Rule8: Whenever a Team publishes Findings, the Team maps a Genome.
Rule9: Provided that a Reviewer validates an Experiment, then if a Team patents a Method, the Team sequences DNA.
Rule10: A Reviewer either validates an Experiment or replicates Results.
Rule11: Whenever a Reviewer replicates Results, then if a Team patents a Method, the Team sequences DNA.
Rule12: Either a Device measures a Signal or detects an Anomaly.
Rule13: Under the condition that a Device detects an Anomaly, the Project is successful.
Rule14: If a Device malfunctions, then it is not the case that the Device is connected to a Network.
Rule15: A Technician either repairs a Device or replaces a Device.
Rule16: Whenever a Technician replaces a Device, the Device does not malfunction.
Rule17: If an EthicsBoard approves a Protocol, then if a Technician repairs a Device, the Device does not malfunction.
Rule18: Under the condition that a Journal accepts a Paper, the Journal prints an Issue.
Rule19: Either a Journal accepts a Paper or, provided that the Project is not successful, an Author submits a Manuscript.
Rule20: Whenever a Journal prints an Issue, the Journal distributes Copies.
Rule21: If a Journal prints an Issue, then it is not the case that the Journal distributes Copies.
Rule22: Provided that a Researcher presents at a Conference, then the Researcher operates a Microscope.
Rule23: If a Researcher attends a Workshop, then either a Lab analyzes Data or, under the condition that the Lab does not use a Computer, the Lab calibrates a Sensor.
Rule24: Provided that a Researcher trains a Student, then either a Lab analyzes Data or, if the Lab does not use a Computer, the Lab calibrates a Sensor.
Rule25: Under the condition that a Researcher visits a Lab, the Researcher collaborates with an Institute.
Rule26: A Researcher either visits a Lab or consults an Expert.
Rule27: If a Researcher consults an Expert, then the Researcher either attends a Workshop or trains a Student.
Rule28: Whenever a Lab acquires Equipment, then either the Lab analyzes Data or, provided that the Lab does not use a Computer, the Lab calibrates a Sensor.
Rule29: Provided that a Lab upgrades Software, then the Lab maintains a Facility.
Rule30: If a Researcher writes a Paper, then under the condition that the Project is not successful, the Researcher publishes in a Journal.
Rule31: Either a Device is secure or, if a Device malfunctions, then the Device is connected to a Network.
Rule32: If a Journal rejects a Paper, then it is not the case that the Journal accepts the Paper.
Rule33: Either a Journal rejects a Paper or an Author revises a Paper.
Rule34: Whenever an Author withdraws a Paper, then the Author does not resubmit the Paper.
Rule35: If a Lab uses a Computer, then the Project is successful.
Rule36: A Lab either models a Simulation or either analyzes Data or, if the Lab does not use a Computer, calibrates a Sensor.
Rule37: If it is not the case that if a Team records a Video then the Project is successful, then the Team contaminates a Sample.
Rule38: Provided that it is not the case that if a Device measures a Signal then the Project is successful, then the Device malfunctions.
Rule39: Under the condition that it is not the case that either a Researcher presents at a Conference or writes a Paper, then the Researcher is funded by a Grant.
Rule40: If it is not the case that either a Researcher presents at a Conference or writes a Paper, then it is not the case that the Researcher is funded by a Grant.
Rule41: Provided that it is not the case that if a Device is tested then the Device is not secure, then the Device is reliable.
Rule42: If it is not the case that if a Device is tested then the Device is not secure, then the Device is not reliable.
Rule43: Under the condition that it is not the case that if an Author revises a Paper then the Journal does not accept the Paper, then the Author resubmits the Paper.
Rule44: Provided that it is not the case that if an Author revises a Paper then the Journal does not accept the Paper, then the Author withdraws the Paper.

Rule45: Whenever it is not the case that if it is not the case that either a Paper cites a Study or it is not the case that a Device malfunctions then the Paper is retracted, then the Paper is corrected.

Rule46: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either a Paper cites a Study or it is not the case that a Device malfunctions then the Paper is retracted, then it is not the case that the Paper is corrected.
Rule47: If it is not the case that a Lab acquires Equipment, then the Lab upgrades Software.
Rule48: If the Project is not successful, then it is not the case that an Author submits a Manuscript.
facts: Fact1: An EthicsBoard approves a Protocol.
Fact3: It is not the case that a Researcher publishes in a Journal.
Fact4: It is not the case that a Researcher operates a Microscope.
Fact5: A Researcher does not collaborate with an Institute.
Fact6: A Lab does not maintain a Facility.
Fact7: It is not the case that a Paper cites a Study.
Fact8: A Paper is not retracted.
Fact9: A Lab does not calibrate a Sensor.
Fact10: A Lab does not analyze Data.
Fact11: A Lab does not model a Simulation.
